resources.string: Customize your QS panel and notifications
Customize your navigation bar & recents overview

Smart pixels is a power saving feature. Depending on how many pixels you decide to turn off, you could see a significant improvement in battery life. For a good user experience, we recommend you set the amount of disabled pixels at 75 percent.

If you find a bug with any of these settings, report it in our Telegram Group. You MUST include the following when posting a bug report:

1. A logcat or last_kmsg
2. Kernel and mods used
3. Useful information

If you fail to report something adequately, DO NOT expect things to be fixed.
Press on color below to apply
View or change power menu entries
Double tap on the top third or bottom shortcut area of the lock screen to put the device to sleep
Double-tap status bar to put the device to sleep
Double tap power button (slower single tap response)
Jump to camera gesture is now disabled
Pressing the volume keys will wake your device
Long press volume buttons to switch tracks while screen off
Display 4G icon in signal icon instead LTE
Swap volume buttons when the screen is rotated
Disable power menu on lock screen
This will only disable the power menu on secure lock screens
Display the app\'s icon corresponding with the toast
Disable expanding quick settings on secure lock screens
Disable heads up notifications in these applications
Disable heads up from these applications
Peeking notifications will show for %d seconds
Swiping up on peeking notifications will snooze heads up from that application for 1 minute
Swiping up on peeking notifications will snooze heads up from that application for %d minutes
Abbreviated day of the week before the time
Display custom date before the clock
Must be in DateFormat eg. MM/dd/yy
Enable the running services icon in the footer
Enable the tile edit icon in the footer
Let everyone know that you\'re using AEX when they see your screen
Show the network traffic indicator arrows
Save battery by shutting off extra pixels
Enable with battery saver to increase power savings
Battery light in Do Not Disturb mode
Display the cross sign next to signal bar when data is disabled
Display roaming indicator in signal icon when in roaming mode
Button backlight brightness will adjust based on current screen brightness level
Button backlight will only appear when buttons are pressed rather than on all the time. Timeout still impacts this feature.
Show visualizer bars while playing music
Use a smooth lava lamp style color blend animation
Show a brightness slider in the quick settings panel
Show a brightness slider on bottom quick settings
Display a warning at bottom of QS panel when network is monitored by external apps or vpn
Open quick settings when there are %1$s notifications
Open quick settings when there are no notifications
Show buttons to increase or decrease the brightness
Adjust brightness by sliding across the status bar
Display and customize battery bar near status bar or navigation bar
Blend full/empty colors corresponding to battery percentage
Full → empty: red ← green ← blue ← red
Full → empty: red → green → blue → red
Show heads up only for dialer or messaging app if they are not in foreground
Show a kill app button in the notification\'s longpress menu
Show headers in the notification shade\nRequires a SystemUI restart
Whether to Center notification headers\nRequires a SystemUI restart
Enter a custom label. Leave blank to use your network name
Double tap to wake when device is dreaming
Customize the layout of the navigation bar
Display left and right cursor buttons in navigation bar while typing
Show mobile type icon on top of the signal indicator
Show the extra row of info under the lock clock(SysUI restart may be required)
Show charging current, voltage, wattage and battery temperature on lockscreen while charging
Display an animation when the device is plugged in
Automatically turn on for these apps
Gaming mode will turn on automatically when these apps are opened and turn off when they are closed
Block all headsup messages except calls
Disable hardware buttons when Gaming mode is turned on
Lock screen brightness when Gaming mode is turned on
Try detecting and adding gaming apps automatically
Hide incall ui and enable speaker mode for calls when gaming mode is active
They really cut corners with this one
Use default statusbar height in Hide
Useful if the device actually has rounded corners
Force apps to ignore notch space
Please restart the application to apply the changes.
Display lock icon on the lockscreen
Display status bar on the lockscreen
Light ambient edges for pulsing notifications
Show lights for all doze events and not just notifications
Keep showing edge lightning on AOD
Hide AOD content when edges are lighted
Time it takes for each animation to complete
Amount of times the animation should show\n0 for infinite
Show estimated remaining battery life next to the icon
Choose the style of your statusbar icons (requires SystemUI restart)
Shows an animation while reading your finger
In order to add your own icon, select the top left icon and use the OnePlus 6T FP Customizer app to select the icon you want.
Icons/colors may vary depending on which device you are using.
Show app volume in volume panel
Advanced battery tweaks for your device
Turns on from sunset to a custom time
Turns on from a custom time to sunrise
Disable Wi-Fi when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Bluetooth when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Mobile data when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Location when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Sensors when Sleep mode is turned on
Disable Always on display when Sleep mode is turned on
Enable Aggressive idle and standby when Sleep mode is turned on
Sleep mode allows you to disable certain services to help save battery and silence your phone while you sleep.
